body.name: Getting Even: Two Thrilling Novels of Suspense

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #3,329 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #51 in Suspense (Kindle Store) #60 in Thrillers (Kindle Store) #84 in Murder Thrillers

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Getting Even is a great read. Everything Lisa Jackson writes makes enjoyable reading. This book is a bonus read, it has two stories.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Two for the price of one. both stand alone great warm stories from the master story teller
reviews.reviewText: Couldn’t believe the Lisa Jackson let us have two stories. Both are warm full of heart felt families that get lost in the shuffle of life. First a tale of misunderstanding that leaves a five year gap and family torn apart. Second a missing family and what a woman will put up with to find her missing children.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It was hard to put this book down. To have two stories in the same book was great. I didn’t have to wait for the next one to be published. I have read a lot of Lisa Jackson’s books & they ate all hard to put down.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Written 40 years ago, the plots show their age.
reviews.reviewText: These were excellent in 1986; in 2023, they leave something to be desired.No, I'm not talking about answering machines, the lack of cell phones, or the other anachronisms that end up feeling just a bit out of place.It's the actual PLOT, especially of the second novel, that really struggles. So much so, it's tough at times to stay embedded in the story, even when you are well familiar with how things like parental kidnappings were handled in the 80s. Today, law enforcement would be involved. Given history of domestic abuse, the visitation might well have be limited, if not supervised, instead of handing the kids off for entire weekends at a time. Nationwide agreement on the enforceability of child custody means that merely taking the children to another state gets the abducting parent off the hook. It might have even engendered an Amber Alert.Still, the writing and storyline and dynamics between the main characters are interesting, which pulls you along until you're jolted out of the story with what feels like - to a modern reader - totally unrealistic plot choices.Both titles could really have used a modern refresh before re-release. The first title isn't quite so jarring, but there are still moments where the reader wants to smack the characters... at least until you remember that these characters lived in the 1980s, and the world really has moved on since then.Also, there are a few very small continuity errors, which really aren't a big deal. Unless, like me, you're already being shook due to the Oh Yeah, These Books Are OLD moments.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Not what I would call suspenseful seeing that this is Lisa Jackson but good reads nonetheless. I expected more but enjoyed both stories.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Two books in one
reviews.reviewText: The second was a 5⭐, the first a 3⭐. Both plots and characters were good but the first one drug and needed editing. The second book about a woman whose ex husband disappeared with her children was riveting and the ending was what makes me read this authors books. HEA's with a bite.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It's a book from 1986 with a different cover.
reviews.reviewText: I wish Lisa wouldn't reprint her books with different covers. I had already read these books. There are two books in one cover. The stories are excellent, if you haven't read them before. I don't like being tricked into buying a book a second time. If I don't remember it when I'm purchasing it, then when start reading it and see that it's a reprint in a different cover then I have wasted my money.I have enjoyed this author for many years. I especially love when she and her sister, Nancy Bush, write one together. They compliment each other.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Not as good as her more recent novels
reviews.reviewText: The two stories in this book have not stood well against the test of time.The second story in particular suffered from a not-too- bright female main character and an even dumber attorney, supposedly the best lawyer in Portland. I can't even describe the stupidity of arriving at the home of the non custodial parent, without notifying the local police department, and accepting the canard that regaining custody of the children would be too difficult on the children. The explanations and justifications do not hold water.Much as I enjoy Ms. Jackson's later work, I will be certain to avoid her earlier novels. This was a dud.
This book is amazing. The power of love and motherhood is so very strong. Thus book is definitely a must read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 21, 2023

reviews.reviewText: I just finished this book. Could not put it down. I love anything written by Lisa Jackson.
Suffered my way through this book. Usually a big fan of Lisa Jackson but this book was a difficult read.
